page.title: 06ECOLOGY 3
page.content: The{Higher Ground:}A few years ago the animal and bird populations of the higher ground were numerous and varied . Dramatic{changes}have been brought about by three new factors in farming: The grubbing out of the once extensive orchards. Disappearence of hedgerows to make ever larger fields. The cyclic cultivation of cereals and green vegetables. These factors make for {open environments}visited regularly by man and machines. There are few {'sanctuaries'}left where creatures can make homes or where food producing 'weeds' can establish themselves. A few creatures such as Hares and Skylarks proliferate in their new surroundings. Some such as Foxes and the ubiquitous Hedgehog are tolerant of it. Apart from these and flocks of Seagulls,Crows,Woodpigeons,and Lapwings,these are{desolate}places.
